text:
Battery Park: The Salt Water Floating Bath photographed from the Aquarium, "Castle Garden".  The view is westward across the North (Hudson) River towards the New Jersey Shore.
About 1870.
Urbrock Collection
title: Manhattan: Battery Park.
North (Hudson) River - [River scenes - Manhattan skyline - Bankers Trust Company - Singer Manufacturing Company.]

text:
General View Lower Manhattan: viewing in the general direction of north across the downtown financial district, showing prominently the Bankers Trust Building (with pyramidal tower) and the Singer Building (center). To the right of the latter is the skeleton of the Municipal Building. In the foreground are the Electric Bond and Share Building (left) and the Empire Building (center).

Under construction in view 2 is the Adams Building, the Woolworth Building being left in the background. view 3 shows the Woolworth, Singer, and Equitable buildings.

View 4 is in a northwesterly direction. In the background are the Adams (left) Bankers Trust, and Equitable buildings.

George L. Balgue

View 1: 1911
View 2: 1913
View 3,4: 1914
title: General view - Lower Manhattan (North).

text:
A SECTION FO THE NEW SKYLINE OF DOWNTOWN NEW YORK

At left of the picture is the Bankers Trust Building, on Nassau Street. Near the center is the New Equitable Building, largest in the city. Next to that, and partly hidden, is the Singer Tower. At the extreme right is the Woolworth Building, fifty-one stories high, the tallest structure in the world.

October 1925

Neg. # 2590 , Slide # 141
title: General view - Downtown Manhattan - [View of skyline.]

text:
(1)
North (Hudson) River, north from Battery Park (right) to Barclay Street, showing the skyline of Lower Manhattan. Prominently seen (left to right) are; the New York Telephone Co. Building, Woolworth, Singer, Equitable (two sections), Bankers Trust, Irving Bank Columbia Trust (with graduating tower) and Whitehall Buildings.
October 7, 1925.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
Part of the same, another view. Also shown (right to left) are piers 9 (United Fruit Co.), 10 (Sandy Hook Route), Pennsylvania Ferry Landing and pier 13 (Lackawanna Railroad).
June 6, 1925.

P. L. Sperr.

(3)
Another view from a different angle, and showing (right to left) the landing of the Pennsylvania Railroad Ferry, and piers 13 (Lackawanna Railroad), 14 (Fall River Line), 15 (New England Line), the Hoboken Ferry landing and piers 16 and 17 of the New York Central Railroad.
June 6, 1925.

P. L. Sperr.
title: North (Hudson) River - Shore and skyline - Manhattan - Battery - 14th Street.

title: North (Hudson) River - Shore and skyline - Manhattan - Battery - 14th Street.

text:
(1)
North (Hudson) River, north from Battery Park (right) to Carlisle Street, showing the skyline of lower Manhattan and piers (right to left) 4, 5, 7 and 8. Also shown (right to left) are the Whitehall Building, the tower of the Irving Bank Columbia Trust Building, the tower of the Bankers Trust Building, the Equitable Building and the Singer Building. The point of vantage is the Central Railroad of New Jersey ferry in midstream.
June 6, 1925.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, at a later date, and showing also pier 6 (center of view). From the same point of vantage.
July 29, 1925.

P. L. Sperr.

(3)
The same, at a later date and showing (left to right) the Liberty Street Ferry and piers 11, 10, 9, 8, 7 and 3.
August 1, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.
